T1059.001.name: PowerShell
T1059.001.description: PowerShell is a powerful scripting language and shell framework used by both administrators and adversaries. Adversaries may abuse PowerShell commands and scripts for execution of code and to perform other tasks.

T1027.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
T1027.description: Adversaries may use obfuscation techniques to hide the true intent of their code, scripts, or executable files in order to avoid detection or analysis.

T1105.name: Ingress Tool Transfer
T1105.description: Adversaries may transfer tools or other files from an external system into a compromised environment to facilitate their objectives.

T1059.003.name: Windows Command Shell
T1059.003.description: The Windows Command Shell (cmd.exe) is a native command-line interpreter for Windows, commonly used by adversaries to execute commands and scripts.

T1203.name: Exploitation for Client Execution
T1203.description: Adversaries may exploit software vulnerabilities in client applications to execute arbitrary code or commands on a system.
